### **1. What is 5G and How Does It Work?**
5G (fifth-generation wireless technology) uses higher-frequency radio waves (millimeter waves: 24–100 GHz) compared to earlier generations (2G/3G/4G, which used lower frequencies). These higher frequencies allow for faster data speeds and lower latency but have shorter ranges, requiring more cell towers and small-cell installations (e.g., on streetlights, buildings).
